Also, I wanted to try the mussels, but either you order them with fries (which I wasn't going to eat) or you order a huge amount for more than £11, that it's good for sharing but not for myself. I don't know, they should have the option of ordering them alone, but I guess everybody loves fries...

yqX8l6A8RBcvEqRjQAu_bw.text: Good belgian food that fills you up and is cheap too! Go before 7pm to get their special pricing for mussels and fries, and you will not be disappointed. Perfect for a group of friends as they have large tables and very informal setting. They also have a wide selection of beers to try!

xZYHjdQfOo-hbdOlj5kodg.text: This is a really good place for burgers and fries. I ordered the angus burger with onions (should have gotten the caramelized onions) and also with cheese. The burger was really good.

nxCbFE2LdUNCVNI2rZl7pw.text: I love Belgo Centraal! It has great atmosphere (better than the one on Kingsway, I think), and is great if you're looking for a place to bring family and friends.I brought my mother's coworker's family here tonight, who were on vacation from out of town. They loved it. The men thoroughly enjoyed the wide selection of beers, and the servers were great at making recommendations for them. As always, the mussels are good. My favorite is the Green Thai mussel pot, but I've also had the Mariana (garlic, white wine, cream) which is good but could be a bit more flavorful, as well as the Florentine (which is good but a bit too rich for my taste).The staff dresses in monk's robes to go with the whole Belgian monastery-brewery theme, and the entire left side of their alcohol menu has monastically-brewed beers.They also have a kid's menu, which makes it family friendly.I recommend making a reservation so you don't have to wait.

tYdopKb3RJMju3ymi3PMog.text: Ahhh, Belgo. It was my first night in London and I don't think I could have had a more fun meal to start my trip. They specialize in Mussels, Frites and Bier. The bier was outstanding. I had a Blanche De Bruxelles. It was extremely cold (sometimes had to find in England, from my experiences) light and crisp. Delicious. Theie were frites everywhere. I ordered the fried Haddock and it was AWESOME. My husband had some kind of roast chicken dish and he claimed it was the best that he ever had. Strangley, when we got there around 9:30pm, they notified us they were out of mussels which was supposed to be one of their specialities. Oh well. The seating is picnic table/communal and the servers are dressed as monks. The bathrooms are strange as both sexes share sinks. Give it a whirl if you're in the covent garden area. Very noisy, but lots of fun.

zKvQJUbCWRHsyrF245uLdQ.text: Alright. Here's the deal...literally:1. Arrive at Belgo between 5-7, (M-Fri) preferably right at 52. Get escorted past the 'kitchen army' slaving away cooking and serving delicious mussels3. Sit in the biergarden section and order the mussels & frites special, with a Cristal beer to wash it down4. Receive a bowl of crispy delicious frites and steaming mussels in a delicious both5. Savor, eat, drink6. Pay for what you get, at the time your ordered....5pm = 5 quid! Best deal in Londontown.And while it's not so cheap during the weekend (around 12 quid) you can get a bigger bowl (i think it's acutally a cauldron) of other varieties of mussels, that are a lot bigger and arguably more delicioius. I liked the cream and wine variety the best....although it was more of a splurge when I was trying to 'Beat the Clock'. There are a few other locations, but I like this one best for eats.

orZZOlChgb3nIplOfGAuYA.text: This place is great if you fancy some mussels and a different flavored kinda beer. Came here last year for a mates welcome home dinner. Place can seem a little crammed but could be due to the layout but can feel nice and cosy too. Food is great and you will be satisfied too. I always go for the big bowl of mussels to share as a starter although you can have this for main. Then I had the lamb shank which was amazingly soft and just fell of the bone. Dessert is another yummy too.. check out my pics..

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. The different flavour beers that friends ordered
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Very yummy Chocolate cake
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. waffle with ice cream

Fabd667g1ygcrlAQWC5qEQ.text: A totally reasonable place to eat lunch on Kingsway, but not all that remarkable. The weekday lunch specials are a great value, the mussles are good, and the sandwiches are fine. I'd imagine it's excellent for big groups, as they have big tables available and there seemed to be large gatherings of LSE graduate students enjoying a slow lunch while I was there.Enjoy.

d_H8KOq6U4aghZiDdqI_MA.text: Belgo is so fun! I came for my birthday dinner and loved it. "Beat the Clock" is a great deal where you choose off of certain items on a menu and then pay according to what time you ordered (if you order at 5 pm, you pay five pounds. The deal only lasts from 5-6.30 PM!)The pot of mussels were great, though the mussel platters were amazing too. I had the Florentine mussel platter and could not stop eating the amazing green sauce with melted cheese!! I also tried the Beef Carbonnade, which was interesting... I liked that it was really soft tender chunks of meat, but I wasn't really digging the sweet, fruity taste of the sauce.The selection of fruity beers was amazing as well. Tried my first passionfruit and mango beers!Can't wait to come back :)

z1Ev_bWblzo4926MeuiKzg.text: Beer, and lot's of it! This must be Belgo's the Belgium restaurant, where there is possible the largest choice of beers I have ever come across. A rather intriguing choice of fruit beers, dark beers, light beers and ales, for those thirsty for that bloaty goodness. However this is a strange place, that I struggle to make my mind upon. The choice of food is average: moules frites; steak; bangers and mash, but there are about ten different variations on the muscles, and you can even get a personal favourite of mine, the wild boar sausage. What's strange about the food though is the main focus on the plate will have been cooked with a lot of care and consideration, where as the trimmings are a little bit lifeless. This seems to be a resounding theme throughout Belgo's, and this is why I struggle to make my decision. Yes it is somewhat exciting at first, but the layout is a little clunky, and you kind of feel that you're in a somewhat upmarket school diner.I would probably recommend Belgo's to a very specific type of person, perhaps someone who's more up for "sh**s and giggles" rather than a true dining experience. Belgo's has become quite popular in recent years, and I would have to point out to you that you may need to make a reservation first.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

q05pR1phoXQLdtCOJLHmIA.text: Oh yeah, this place has to be on your must visit list. The facility is super cool, the vibe is young and hip, the food is great, and the beer...well it's Belgian beer folks, and nothing but. Need I say more? Really? Goooooo. Tonight!!!

UmkPVpW9TLcoDYQHzkzcwg.text: I have ordered mussels in a pot. They were delicious. And the fries were even better. They serve a large range of beers. But if you are looking for a quiet place to meet up with friends and catch up this place might not be the one you're looking for. It's really loud and crowded. You need to shout to make yourself heard.

3NTxkPs3doxROkwRttk34Q.text: Great Belgian beer as so many selections , love the atmosphere here . i tried the steak mixed with grill lobster on the side . it was so yummy .

gRk-ffToOO_Mc6FGBPl6XQ.text: Belgo has become a regular lunch and dinner spot for my boyfriend and me.  The atmosphere is inviting and the staff friendly, the combination of that and the food; make it a place you'd like to return to.  We both love the express lunch.  I normally enjoy either the split chicken or the mussels with frites and a glass of house wine, a nice filling lunch for less than £8.  The chicken is moist and comes in a chilli ginger sauce which only adds to the flavour.  The frites are always warms and crispy, served with mayonnaise, they are the best.  The mussels at lunch are good but I prefer having them at dinner.The mussels at dinner come in a variety of pots.  I love the mussels in the green Thai sauce.  The mussels absorb the flavour of the coconut, green chilli and lemon grass, heavenly.  The mussels are just enough, that by the end of the meal I'm full but not stuffed.  I always need help with my frites, but thankfully not much.  My partner, not being a fan of mussels, orders the chicken, lamb or beef, all of which are extremely good, I know because I always nibble from his plate.  Belgo is a great place for lunch or dinner, if you go for dinner, be prepared to wait for 30-45 minutes (maybe longer).  To avoid a long wiat, try to get there before 8:00. But, if you have to walk right in or have to wait, trust me, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

lbHmXoGLyB9eGF5CK-Z_eQ.text: I went to London to visit a friend and this was one of the restaurants she took me to. I still think about it pretty often and wonder why we don't have a restaurant like this in San Francisco. I was never a fan of mussels until I came to Belgo. I've recommended this place to people who travel to London and they all seem to enjoy it.

mgVqN6oGskxhmnLnDmG_8Q.text: As a Belgian, I find myself more than partial to a good portion of mussels, steaks, and crispy fries once in while.  (note that fries were actually invented in Belgium and not France which makes the term 'French Fries' completely derogatory!)  When my craving for those types of food becomes too much I like to head to this restaurant for a good fix.  The restaurant itself has a contemporary warehouse feel to it.  The bar is the perfect place to taste Belgian beers whilst waiting for a table.  You can then make your way down to the restaurant area.  A classic choice of Moules Mariniere or Provencale with some white wine or a beer will always be satisfying, otherwise they also have a good selection of meats.  The dinner menu prices are moderate but they do have some special deals for lunch time that are worth checking out.  It is probably best to make a reservation if you are planning to come here on a Friday or Saturday night.  This is not the best Belgian food I have ever had, but it still manages to hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

rq-Xq2U97PJ1rdCvwT7L0g.text: Still like this place. Not as noisy as I remembered it.Food is pretty good, though I wouldn't get the Thai style mussels. They were fine, just not as good as some of the others.Service is great considering how busy they are. Toilet arrangement is kinda dumb.

efmrU7czODXCfAho-3uUzg.text: One I always make a point to come to while in London! Cool sub-basement setting where you can dine in the restaurant portion or the beer garden (common table seating). The beer list is fantastic, the setting is trendy/cozy, and the mussels are not to be missed! Looks like they have opened up many more locations, but this one by far has the coolest vibe and setting.I was a little bummed they no longer great you with schnapps at your table, but they seem to still have it on the menu as an option. Ah well, just make up for it with another round of beer!

M5AiRSo82bYpGKVIpPXcTg.text: Let it first be known that I am not the biggest fan of mussels, but my traveling companion was, so we decided to try Belgo. It's an interesting layout, because you are underground, essentially in a cave. It's not the most glamorous place to dine and it felt a bit industrial to me. I tried the chorizo mussels and the pot would have been big enough to share, they just lacked flavor. The couple next to us got one of the chicken dishes and it looked great, so if I was to return, I would try that instead.

3qLiOOZ3HzVp30pdnksbDQ.text: moules + frites + beer = perfectionI've never been let down by Belgo. I've been here a few times because it's good, quirky, and conveniently located in the heart of Covent Garden.  The seating is located in a basement area, which surprisingly has an 'open' feel. Come here if you want a casual fun dinner! (...that kind of sounded like an advertisement, but I swear it's not)The moules are always fresh and perfectly cooked. I would personally recommend the Snob and the duck confit salad. They serve Fruli here too which is HUGE a plus!

kv9t03AyIrqwk0bD9W5zOA.text: Great place! Great service! Cool downstairs restaurant. Really liked the croquets and the chicken

2Ba0M4aOWMVYrnHjZGIM2g.text: Hmmm...nearly 100 people already reviewed this place! You don't need my opinion...but I'll give it to you anyway. Mwahahahaa!For lunch: 4 stars ****For dinner 5-7pm: 4 stars ****For dinner with no awesome discounts: 3 stars ***I really like Belgos...I have even been known to wait in the 'beer pen' and have a drink when there are not enough tables. When you pay for the time you arrive (eg. order at 6:45pm = pay £6.45 it's a bargain!! However, if you come a bit later, and order the same dishes that you could have an hour earlier for less than half the price...I always feel a little let down.Last night my friends and I arrived a little too late for one of the awesome cheap-eating deals, but it was still a pleasure to munch my way through a giant pile of muscles in Thai flavoured sauce. I'll probably keep coming back here for happy comfort food and silly long trays of schnapps. (^^)

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Thai muscles... slurpy love. :)

ANtGvgFfCYmxSymK7zct-Q.text: My friend had his birthday dinner here last weekend, though I'd never heard of it before despite its central location in Seven Dials. They also have 3 more locations around London, and once inside you realize that the restaurant is enormous. Apparently they have their own beer supplier in Belgium that brews their house Belgo Wit and Belgo Pils. I had a few pints of the Belgo Wit and found it light, pleasant and easy to drink. I was however very disappointed that these were 2 of the 3 beers that they had on tap, and the rest were all bottled. We were seated downstairs in a cave-like room past the beer hall, which comfortably fit 25-30 people. I can see why this place would be really great for parties. Even though Belgium isn't known for a beer hall culture, they had a large beer hall section with tables of 8-10, and where I heard reports of people dancing on tables for a brief period of time (I don't think that is particularly normal). As for the food, we had a few of the giant planks, which included cheese, crudités, cured meats, and some chutneys. We then ordered individually and to my surprise, the rotisserie and the burgers were quite popular choices among our group. I didn't consider any menu option besides mussels and ended up getting the Snob, which is served in lobster bisque. I thought the mussels were high quality, decently sized and very clean, and it was more than enough to eat. They also came served with pretty good fries, but I thought it was disappointing that they didn't give us each our own mayonnaise and ketchup, and instead we had to share a small dish of each amongst 2-3 people. Another nice thing would have been bread to eat with the broth of the mussels, but that had to be ordered separately. One of my friends managed to make quite a mess eating the mussels, so perhaps they should consider providing bibs...Overall I think this is a great casual restaurant for large groups. I don't think I'm in any rush to come back for the food, but if you are into your Belgian beers, this is a good bet.

KLEB8FjCEfFcRxBgkITUPA.text: Eat at a Belgian Restaurant while in London? Sure, why not! My friend that I was traveling with had found this place on Trip Advisor (I am usually skeptical about that site), but I was pleasantly surprised. Covent Garden was short ride on the tube, it was a fun little area, cobblestone streets, pubs, clothing stores, etc. We couldn't decide on which moules, so we ordered two kilo pots (way too much food for two people) we ordered the Traditionelle (white wine, celery, garlic and onion) and the Thai (lemongrass, chili, ginger, kaffir lime, coconut and coriander). I preferred the Traditionelle as I thought the flavor was fantastic. The moules were excellent, big and juicy and fresh. We ordered bread so we could dip it into the pots (highly recommend soaking the sauce up with the bread). Lots of beer to choose from, I had a couple rounds of Mongozo coconut beer, which was so flavorful (not a lot of alcohol tho).

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Croquettes
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Thai & Traditionelle moules

KPe979GqDU8IdPALRrJ6ww.text: Like most reviewers, I had a great dining experience at Belgo... but let's talk about the drinks! I came here on a week night with two friends who were in town from the States. We were blessed with a waitress (I believe her name was Roxanne?) who was highly knowledgeable on the international beer selection available at the restaurant. She impressed us so much with her knowledge of ingredients, brewing techniques, and history that we relinquished control and allowed her to choose all of our drinks. Thanks to her infinite wisdom, I was able to try delicious beers that I probably would have overlooked.Good friends plus good drinks equals a great time. Thank you, Roxanne... or whatever your name is!

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

nN7v1vBFfXH4IaBdlSirfA.text: Original Belgian food in London for a fair price. This really is as good as it gets. :)

jAdFJqrsOi50KnGTPNqSbw.text: Impressive seafood menu with great drink menu, but not the ideal place for a quiet dining, retro design.

-yM3XP_O-9RZwjOGv_VEBg.text: Close to the Hoxton Hotel and in a cute neighborhood (The Seven Dials). Had their traditional mussels which were great - not too salty, mussels a bit small but still tasty. Had the hot chicken wings to start - they were also super small and the hot sauce is mixed with ketchup. The prawn risotto is a bit too buttery and rich for my liking and Belgo burger was good (topped with a large pickle!) Service was OK. People were friendly but waited over 45mins for our dinner (I think they forgot about us because our original server was nowhere to be found). Overall a good place to go for dinner. If you have a large party, it's great! Lots of space and room.

matICYr5kOOFwMPwXP81GA.text: Belgo is still the lively restaurant which is great for a big group of ppls . They also still take reservations,  which is fantastic compared lots of newly opened trendy Restaurant That forces ppls to wait forever in the cold!! Those new Restaurant really need to stop doing That and let the customers suffer and wasting time in the queue!! Love Belgo for their efficient booking even though they are always full. We suddenly increase from 12 to 18 ppls on the date and they manage it very well. However,  I gave three stars due to food quality and long waiting time for main courses on the night. It is great to see Belgo add lots of new favour for mussels,  But the mussels are quite small and can taste much fresher.  Their steak is well cooked, But the meat quality is bad so it doesn't taste as good as other Restaurant.  So, Belgo is  still a good place for a big group party with comfy food ,  but I will not specifically come here for food tasting.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Escargot mussels
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Lobster sauce mussels
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin steak

InGpH91FFl33tYTYKAnxWg.text: When you walk in you are greeted by a hostess before you head down the stairs to the actual restaurant. The restaurant is quite large and you get to peek into the kitchen when you walk to the toilets. The waiters and waitresses are all dressed in monk like outfits and were quite friendly and fast. On a Sunday evening it was pretty busy, but we still were able to get in and out within an hour.The chicken was tender and complimented well by the roast tomato and chorizo sauce. The mussels had good flavor and I probably only had 1-2 out of the whole bucket that were not open. Fries were crispy and not too salty.We will have to come back for the beer and mussel specials!Roast tomato, chorizo & herb half spit-roast chicken, basted in Belgo's secret spices and served with salad or Belgian fritesMoules Kil Pots Thai Lemongrass, chilli, ginger, kaffir lime, coconut and corianderVegetables Warm asparagus, broccoli and green beans

eZgjXZ_BkODmhLZN2hfYcA.text: You cannot do better unless you go to Belgium.  Forget the menu - order the full order of mussels with frites.  Chase them down with a Duvel or a Leffe or similar Belgian brew.  Have 2-3 beers at lunch and say to hell with it all!   This place is a celebration.

0R2a2fUScZFcSeujGRS5kQ.text: I don't care for Belgian food, but we came here for the beer. SO MANY CHOICES OF BEER. It was hard to choose. If you're looking for a cool spot to grab a beer with friends come here.

1FJ2eMrzN6H3mtQ6Q_IWhA.text: Traveling alone in London for business so was very easy to get a seat. Pinic style seating. Lots of craft beers on tap. I had the leffe blond and the chorizo pot of mussels. Came out quickly. Very good. Fresh and could taste the smoky chorizo in the broth. Came with a small side of fries. Would go back

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo mussel pot

501bklemsFAGRAVC2HG2_w.text: Best mussels in London. I would eat there again if I wanted mussels as the mussels are very tasty, fresh and you get a large portion however the chips were cold. What I don't like about the restaurant is the way the tables are, the noise level and atmosphere. It feels like a fast food joint and too many children. Also I was quite annoyed to have a service charge on the bill even though it was just two of us (12.5%). When we asked for it too be taken off the waitress had to go and ask if that was ok even though the bill said optional.

wHY-oUnkxlt5l6J1lcDF1A.text: I'm having a bit of a love affair with all things Belgian at the moment, having recently visited Bruges and dined on some of the finest beers, mussels and waffles I've ever tasted, Belgo was always going to be facing stiff competition.As a venue I loved it, it's very cool, unique and urban. The beer menu on the tables a definite plus, and the beers actually being served in the matching glasses, a thoughtful and appreciated touch. Whilst I would definitely recommend Belgo's to beer appreciators, I did have a few issues with the service. To start I ordered a blonde zot but received the dark and the table next to us also received the wrong side orders. When I asked the waitress to change my beer as per my order, she took the beer off the table, didn't apologise,  and was in no hurry to bring me my replacement. I am quite patient and I completely understand waiting for service when the waiter/ress is having to serve several tables but having been given menu's to start and then for dessert, we found ourselves waiting some time for the waitress to return to take our order, even though she was standing at the side of the room gazing into the distance whilst we waved our menus.On to the taste - I had the mussels provencale, now I am a mahoo-sive garlic fan, but for me there just wasn't much flavour. The Belgian waffle on the other hand was gorgeous and the chocolate sorbet divine!Whilst I have highlighted a few negatives, I would still recommend Belgo's and will probably return again, just hoping for a bit more attentive service next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. One menu for food and one for beer!
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Mussels provencale

Wyi10sdvRkupBWWrVmyntg.text: I've been to this restaurant twice.  The first time was in December 2008 and everything was spectacular.  The second time was in May 2015.  The food was spectacular, but the service average.The Traditionelle Moules are absolutely amazing.

w0mRI4OHtYr_Z_S4klOPZw.text: Offering an excellent selection of Belgian beers, great stodgy food menu, excellent chips (served with mayo, of course) and heavenly chocolate ice cream this is a great place to head for lunch liquid or otherwise. Can be a bit busy on weekend evenings but the sister restaurant is a few blocks aways on Kingsway.

RLufWrIoanaI8npneKB6qQ.text: really enjoyed my meal at Belgo's. I had the surf and turf and would recommend this place to all my friends! The prices are reasonable to.

RQdTguVwEM8asV1QT6sQKw.text: Not a great way to celebrate a friend's birthday - waited 1.5 hrs for a lukewarm lobster and chips, and staff to busy to get them to warm it up. Birthday singing with dessert was a nice gesture but did not make up for this poor level of service and shocking output from the kitchen. I was expecting much better after seeing reviews.

XFMpgOy7TYWeYO9TQK4JCg.text: Belgo Centraal is one of the things I miss most about London: I didn't go here enough when I lived in the city, and I can't find mussels as good as the ones I had here!  I can't remember what else we ordered, but the mussels were the stand out.  They came in this white wine broth with some french fries to soak it all up... my mouth is watering just thinking about it!  They also had a massive beer selection, but I don't drink beer so that wasn't too interesting for me.  The other people in my party enjoyed it, however!  The decorum of the restaurant isn't quite what I expected.  There's this industrial vibe going on, and the place is HUGE.  Despite the size, the staff was still very attentive.  The prices may seem steep, but the portions are large so it all works out, and if I remember correctly, they have some pretty nice lunchtime deals.  I highly recommend this place.

hWFKGkxm6mt_Mu0iUDzD6A.text: Love love love Belgo Centraal!  The mussels here are delicious.  My company has an office in the UK so I visit at least once a year.  Belgo Centraal is always a dinner stop during the trip.The food here is meant for sharing...this way you can order a lot off the menu.  The thai mussels are my favorite.  Definitely order some bread for dipping in the broth.  The last time I visited, I also ordered their chicken...that was really good as well.  Dessert...decadent!  Endless types of beers as well.If you are in London, definitely give this place a try and you'll fall in love!

iANZagsNVGQAMliwtDhGeg.text: I originally stumbled upon this place by chance and had no idea it was so popular - I totally understand why. Although their cavernous space is indeed a bit kitchy, the food is really really good. They have great moules frites - I would recommend coming "beat the clock" special times and ordering them as its a fantastic deal. The rest of their menu is really good too. They have some tasty appetizers - my favorites being the grilled goat cheese with roasted peppers and sundried tomatos and the three cheese croquettes. Obviously I would recommend ordering mussells here (when in Belgium...) but I've tried some of their other entrees which are also quite good - specifically the beef carbonade and the haddock. Mmmmm. Great dessert menu too!

oNbWrCsJMTa2wdLOOq_zZA.text: A fun, huge, noisy place with a fantastic beer selection.  the seating is at longish tables so I think it would be a great place for larger groups.  Our waiter was very busy, but good and the mussels &f rites where delicious.  Anyone who knows me knows that I love my Belgian beer and even brew my own Belgian styles at home (dubble, flanders red, flanders brown, lambics, etc.).  I am always looking for a chance to try new ones and the Belgo did not disappoint.  Also, we went here with 4 adults and 2 children.  Children are very welcome here and they have a kids menu where kids even eat free!

ggBcMfsJbnGQMku0cLrYCQ.text: Belgos, Covent Garden AKA the beer dungeon. Whenever I'm in central and really stuck for somewhere to eat that sits between getting a Burger King or going to a fancy restaurant I can't afford, then Belgos is the one. It's pretty much always busy without being overcrowded and the friendly staff manage to maintain a good level of service despite its hectic atmosphere. Probably best known for their mussels and mahoosive selection of beers (highly recommend the cherry!) the prices are excellent for what is delicious food. They also do a genius beat the clock offer where your meal cost is equal to whatever time you arrived eg. 7pm = £7...basically pretty nifty for skin-flints like myself.

SPio095-ou1WBIyEy80BJQ.text: Granted, it's been 5 years since I ate here, but I still remember the meal. We were in London for Christmas week. The beer was fantastic, the mussels excellent, and the atmosphere (underground beer hall with monks serving ales) was great. One of the most memorable meals of our week in London. I look forward to going back some day.

YU-aKVZ6LOip8rZfjzvCVA.text: Belgoo Central, is the best place in London to eat Mussels and Fries. It is not really expensive and delicious. Everybody is seated around long table, this is very convivial. We had our food in 15 minutes and there is a large choice of lager. Nice experience, to try again!

hxuw7WsU4XOq9bLbFvlxnQ.text: Though its never going to win any major gastronomy awards, Belgo Centraal is excellent for a slightly tipsy lunch or a slightly drunk early dinner -- their deals are excellent. The food, if not exactly anything out of this world, is always tasty (consistency is sadly lacking in many a restaurant) and the beer always plentiful. A good neighborhood go-to when you're tired of schlepping yourself around the shops.

_ALzpFKrmYYFnsjxcCr3Cg.text: Excellent place for a good and speedy lunch.  In and out in an hour.  £7.95 express lunch includes a small glass of a Belgian lager!  The mussels are excellent.

f9nTHFk9UHY27EzKBGNnYg.text: Had a great time at belgos. The food was great and the staff were fantastic making us feel really welcome. I would highly recommend belgos. We made a reservation which was confirmed by phone the next day so points for that. Once we arrived we were quicly seated and advised of the special. Rhe food was really great quality and the range of beers mind boggerling ! The waitress though could advise us on the various beers. We both had a great time and will certainly be going back.

mDfLl-SVjf-i5s31suAsQA.text: Great Belgian beer selection with some fuit beers which I had never seen before. We were visiting from the states and met some of our UK friends there. The curry mussel pot was excellent as well as their open faced mussels on a half. My friend had the florentine which were very good as well, rich and filling. The portions are large and plenty for a meal. An excellent place to have drinks and a bite to eat with friends. a 12.5% tip is included and the staff is prompt and attentive. 80 quid or so with drinks for Four people. Cheers.

ClW1MIfiXdvB_EuhyDcMyw.text: A lively and noisy restaurant in central London. On the plus side, the food is tasty and the selection of beer is astounding. On the negative side, the allotted 2 hours to eat is enforced and very annoying. Whilst I enjoyed the food and drink, I won't return until they change this policy.

7nz2ttYje5PiG8sOImgEMA.text: I can say we were there when they first opened! Great for beer, mussels and frites (especially if you like them with mayo). Yum! Of course communal dining is par for the course but it makes for fun conversation and of course if you run out of frites you can just snag some from your neighbor!

zQG5heNdhJeE5Oh_wZdZyg.text: A great menu with great staff. Not expensive at all and really good to enjoy with friends.Recommended for the best mussels and frites. Extended beer selection and nice wines also.

qKRdMI6S06KI1K9sm9rdNw.text: Considering virtually their sole focus is the moules it has gone from being a great place to eat to just average. It is now unfortunately of a similar standard to Nandos, i.e. One step up from fast food. Unfortuntely at between £50 and £60 for two people with drinks it doesnt fall into the Nandos price bracket. The only thing that raises Belgos above 2 stars for me is the amazing selection of Belgian beers. I usually have the mariniere and its ok, no better than that. I have had better and fresher mussels in numerous other places, sad really as this is all they really do.

9kRk6goA1Ttpw3BsCr8_vQ.text: All Belgo branches are great but my favourite is the one in Covent Garden  for the location, the atmosphere and the chef there.

rcKE7btzhNgvOUOkemOUPg.text: Belgo Centraal has a cafeteria cool kind of vibe going on. Very loud, seating like in a school cafeteria but it feels completely welcoming especially as a solo traveler. The food is delicious, service is excellent -all around 5 stars for this place. I just wish that one of these places existed in my hometown.

7IMzOKfwB6KSge6V-zAY7A.text: I miss their pineapple beer.  I try to eat here when I am in London.  They are known for mussels but other things are great too.

bEbgBVFk6lgv7wVDPONCaw.text: An underground tunnel of excitement! This restaurant is not for those who wish to have a quiet sit down meal. Waiters bustling around in over sized monk like gowns, serving every type of flavoured Belgium beer with delicious food; green Thai mussels, frites, steak and duck to match. Put your name down and find a posie in the bar and be prepared to wait up to 4o minutes - it will be worth it!The staff are always so friendly, willing to suggest their favourite dish. The toilets are a fun adventure with spaceship like doors and a shared circular hand basin. The kitchen is open in the centre of the restaurant resulting in delicious smells and a very warm atmosphere.

Os9Y58CqmwadHg0jD0AFAw.text: Years ago I flew to London on business quite a few times a month. One of my colleagues from Belgium introduced me to this place. In a word, "Awesome!" The food is fantastic, but the ambiance is what won me over. The first time I walked in I felt like a monk having dinner in the 1400's. The decor has changed but the quality of the food and service remains the same.  What was that word again?  Oh yes....Awesome!

b2PtA2Bqcy3_Sm9HdexNgg.text: Went here with a group of friends for dinner: venue is large underground banquet hall - esque, with open kitchen. Very noisy. Big selection of european (and mainly Belgian beers). Food was decent, but not great value for money. I would recommend it for a large group of ppl, looking for an unsual dinner venue before going out around Covent Garden / West End. Booking recommended.

peaEJpC2swcsSrW9kE_2CA.text: I've been here a few times with differing folks, and everyone has always loved it. The food is beautiful - the mussels are well delish (coming from a seafood fan) the white chocolate mousse is to die for! Service has been friendly too. Also try the schnapps, esp if with a group of friends to share the taste test experience with

1QM3s0j8sqL3g5P2ucb9ng.text: Cool place. Kinda silly with the "trappist monk" waiters but excellent selection of beer and pretty good food. I really enjoyed their (again very silly) Octoberfeast:londonist.com/2008/10/ok…  Good one to keep in mind when the out-of-towners come to visit.

dBYFqEht_VtdtaOY5rDDkQ.text: We went for a quick meal before a show, and managed to get in on the cheap meal before half six deal, so only paid a fiver each. My partner enjoyed his meal, but mine was a little cold. Also, very poor vegetarian selection. It'a okay for a quick meal, but not a real destination place!

1c6_J2_D7aqSfewYwgTW2Q.text: The food at Belgos is amazing. Obviously mussels are their speciality (I recommend the one sin the Thai Green Curry sauce) but the steak and the chicken are also very very good, as is their freshly cooked bread. The restaurant is set out 'canteen' style so you may be sat quite close to another group. It's also very busy, warm and can be noisy, but this adds to the atmosphere. Can be quite expensive but they often do lunchtime offers.

L4tJmKQrwGjrctkqltUhLA.text: I've walked past here loads of times and have never been able to figure out where you actually eat. Entering the restaurant you get sent downstairs into a cellar beer hall. Somehow they tread that fine line of making it feel traditional, with long beer hall tables and an open kitchen, and funky, using modern materials and designs. Which is the exact vibe I got when travelling in Belgium and I thought very well done! (total aside, but the bathrooms were very cool, with metal sheeting for doors and a unisex water fountain instead of basins) The beer menu is BIG. I thought I like most beer but realised here that there are some beers I definitely like more than others! The beerologist also helped, giving guidance on what will be good to start the evening and expanding on why certain beers go well with certain foods, where they come from and the history and process behind making them. It was very interesting and gave me new insight into the world of beer! The food was delicious. Not the cheapest menu I've seen, but not exorbitant. I had the pork belly and it was excellent  tasty and well prepared but not overly Germanic and heavy. The accompanying grand cru beer was an experience (that I would rather not repeat) but went perfectly with the food. The cheese croquettes to start sat well with the Oval trappist beer (these are made in working monasteries, although the monks are only allowed to sample the fruits of their labour once a week) and the strawberry blonde made my poached pear desert even sweeter (which I loved!).I really thought the food was excellent and the environment made it a very jovial meal. Definitely worth a visit and even more so if you can get a few friends together.

YBkcDE9Uk0Sq2lGYNWJxvw.text: Belgo Centraal  one of my favourite informal restaurants and beer venues in London. Just a couple of minutes walk from Covent Garden tube station Belgo's has a huge beer selection of varying strengths from 2.5% to a mind-blowing 12% on their own menu. They have around 6 draft beers, usually Belgian, and more styles of bottled beer than many places have bottled beers: white beers, fruit beers, 'triple' fermented, Saison, Lambic, Trappist, wine beers, Pilsner, Flemish brown ales, amber beers, golden ales, blonde ales, double dark biers! Plus of course wine, champagne and spirits including Genevers (Dutch Gin) and schnapps. If the beer menu doesn't get you then the food menu includes Mussels (Thai curry, Mariniere, Provencale, Classique, curry); rotisserie chicken, salmon, haddock, wild boar and Chimay beer sausages, steak and occasionally lobster to name a few. The seating area is unusual, long strips of tables make dining rather less formal and certainly not a place to go for an intimate meal, but great fun nonetheless. Beware! I'm not the only one who likes the place, and if you don't book a table you can end up handing around for a while waiting for a table. There is a small upstairs bar area whilst you wait, but that is usually packed too, so be warned.

zeYWBmwpW2u_q_FRt5JRqw.text: Had mussels. You have to really when you go to Belgos. Food wise, it was probably somewhere between a three and four star, but will probably need to go again and assess. Beer was great: lots of choice and all good quality. Service was just ok, a tiny bit rushed as the place is very very popular. All in all, definitely worth a look.

RlVmq9jjZNqJBws85lmQEQ.text: Part of a three part chain, Belgo can sometimes be a bit of a hit or miss experience depending on who serves you. Belgo's offers Belgian food and beer in cavernous atmosphere underground with several signs warning tall people to mind their heads at particular intersections. During the week, they have an amazing beat the clock deal where you pay whatever the time is if you order between, I think, 5 and 6pm. A bargain if you can nip away from work early enough (and you're hungry enough). At lunch they offer another deal where you can order a beer (half pint), or a glass of wine or and a dish from the lunch menu and pay under £6 with the exception of a few dishes that are an additional quid or two more. A bargain considering how big some of the dishes are! Like most Belgian Beer bars, their selection is massive and they even offer a sampling plank with small glasses of many different types of beer that will undoubtedly leave you feeling tipsy.

gZvaFtn-AjHIWUNhjHnDtA.text: Belgo Centraal is a huge underground restaurant in Covent Garden. Book in advance if you can - we didn't and had to wait about half an hour for a table (which isn't unreasonable, especially at the weekend). You enter the restaurant at street level, where there is a bar for pre-dinner drinks. More a standing-room-only bar -- you're in a cage! -- there is a wide range of beers as well as other drinks available. When your table is ready you'll be taken downstairs to the huge cellar that must run under three or four of the neighbouring buildings. There is a large theatre kitchen in the central section allowing you to see what the chefs are getting up to. Tables are arranged in rows school-dinner fashion so you might end up sharing with other parties, but this adds to the relaxed and informal atmosphere of the restaurant. The menu offers a wide selection of Belgian dishes, of course with the obligatory mussels! The food was of high standard and was efficiently served. The waiting-on staff were also friendly and helpful, although they did wander off with my credit card for a while A great restaurant that I would return to when I'm visiting friends in London.

h8gPzvq_6WXyOZUd8W3CZw.text: This is one of the few yelp recommendations which have disappointed me ... and i really don't know why.Its been more than 1.5 years since my last visit to Brussels, and hence my last taste of Belgian food. So i dropped in there this saturday night. It was crowded, but since i was alone, i easily got a table.The decor of the place is unique. Reminds you more of an acid factory, or the Matrix machine city, rather than a restaurant. You have steel pipes everywhere (i would like to find out whether all these are merely decorations or was there some kind of factory in that location earlier) and that, along smoke from the kitchen, gives you an eerie feeling.The service was prompt and friendly. The guy who led me from the staircase (the seating area is a floor below ground level) to the table actually chatted with me ... a rarity in London.This restaurant has a 3 page belgian beer menu ... ranging from those with 0.5% alcohol to those with 12%. You will surely find something that will suit your taste.I ordered a kwak ( abelgian beer brand), and a mussel and crab soup as starter.The soup was served within 3-4 minutes. This place is surely using some 6 sigma technique or something. The service was lightning fast.I actually heard the "kwak" of the kwak for the first time ... made me feel good.My main course was wild boar sausages with some belgian mash. Liked the main dish but not the sauce that came along with it. In fact, i didn't seem to enjoy the food very much. The soup was reasonably good though. There is no specific fault that i can find with the food, but it just didn't feel great.The whole dinner was surprisingly short ... in and out within 45 minutes.

RcmKyfDag_CsOQpoY0JGNA.text: Belgos is a great central London location. You might get put off by the queues, the dark, windowless restaurant, or the hard to find location, but it's worth it. Good, reasonable food (especially the mussels) and nice beers. Would happily go back.

xGLgX_8RdHq9LsjPHMQAOA.text: Best food and drink in central London. Unpretentinous and great quality.

pdqZnscMv8HH8chXsQMtNg.text: Absolutely fantastic restaurant. If you like mussels, this is the place to come to. It does 1kg of mussels in a variety of sauces for around £12. The mussels are big unless some restaurants where you are struggling to find one! If you don't like mussels then there you can order chicken, steak etc. Caters for most people. During the week, it does an offer whereby the price of your meal is on the time you order. E.g I ordered my meal at 5.45 and that was the cost of my meal - with that you get a beer or a soft drink - worth doing! The atmosphere is very vibrant and if you pre book you will be seated in the area that is more of a restaurant area rather than a wagamana style seating. The staff are friendly though during busy periods you can wait for a while to be seated, but they do have a bar, which I must add, is a tad small!!

LnIOJXvkHeGvOdzEIQ-0xg.text: The canteen style decor is cool and the place overall is quite funky. The food is fairly priced and very nice. I went for the mussels (an obvious choice) and frites. There was plenty of wine flowing and overall we had an enjoyable evening. If youre into your Belgian beers, you wouldnt be disappointed as there is a great selection. Also if youre a pudding fiend, there are plenty of yummy sweet treats to pick from. Get there early to get seated as it can get very busy!

W7AK9qsDUFvHs-YWiMXFww.text: yeh l used to be addicted to this place while i was working and had money ha!not too expensive thou and well worth a visit. they somtimes do a lobster offer where you get a lobster for next to nothing.love their fresh bread too. if you have to wait, then wait!

-YRlMDL2EDUjiX5zjCXMbw.text: you had me at mussels and pints.  after a red eye flight and day at conference, when my friend suggested belgo i was entirely game.  i went with the moules blanches bowl.  mussels cooked in brugs white beer with shallots, smoked bacon & parsley.  is your mouth watering yet?my friend had the mariniere mussel pot steamed with cream, white wine, garlic, celery and onion.  i suggested that one.  the bowl and pot were ample shares.  we ended with the waffle with chocolate sauce.  i never knew how good a chimay would be with dessert, but i do now.

nmx_W44rGa6VWdLIM2wltg.text: Outstanding food and great service. A very hip restaurant in a cool neighborhood of London. Can't go wrong here.

hfr8vH6a1ZOcAkV-FUowZg.text: A bit noisy, but my mussels were plump, excellent.  Flavorful broth.   The beer was good, too.   Belgo's no longer offers "beat the clock" but it was still fair value for London central.

zqeTcmNuY8uHcDyS5eE-6w.text: Make a reservation!! There was a wait and almost ran out of moules. I came back the next day and it was much better. Beat the clock deals make coming here worth it as well. I ordered the mussels and fries with the cream based sauce. Tables here are arranged close together and coat hangers do get taken up quickly during the winter hours. Next time I visit London, I'll be back! I just love a good cream sauce.

C_d9jN32ayH9Vb58aqfiKg.text: Service is really slow but the staff are lovely and the food is just fabulous.If you are a fan of their mussel pots but hate eating with your fingers. ...try the roasted platters .... and eat with a knife and fork - what's not to love :-).

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Hard to miss the red external paintwork.
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Sharing benches, great for groups.
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Is not my dessert a thing a beauty... and really delicious too...

fhvmJj0BDxnFgkZhs-LhLQ.text: The way this place operates and the unique food is just neat. BUT it is food that is very very rich and high in fat so be prepared to eat a salad for days afterwards.They have a stunning array of beers and they are mussle worshippers so you MUST order that.It's a little loud because locals come here for their kids' birthdays but it's totally worth it. Great space in the basement too.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Muscles, yo!

jQqjOFKcQ3y_qsRDqBQ6Xw.text: This place was really cool.I took the wife and two young kids. Everyone was super nice and accommodating with the children. We ordered two pots of mussels to share -- the garlic and herb one and the tradittionale one. Both were really yummy, but could have been just a little bit better. It's like the smallest something was missing that I just can't put my finger on.We got frites as the side for both orders of mussels. And why wouldn't you? They are really, really, really good. Crispy and flavorful, they hit the spot. Second only in London to FlatIron I would say.The restaurant itself is massive yet inviting. It's a really cool setting. The rock music is a little loud, but it works.They gave my son a free ice cream cone at the end which I really appreciated and which was super nice of them. I would definitely visit again for the amazing frites and really good mussels.

20CzjaVNxMMszOcyBggzpw.text: It was wild & not in a good way. I went with a large group, planned with the restaurant months in advance, and there were issues the night of, with squeezing in my group of friends. The beer menu was most definitely satisfying, but when it came down to the food (which we all ordered in advance) I would not give it any more than 2.5 stars. One thing I really enjoyed, were the french fries, well... at least their doing something right. No one could hear a thing, the space was very loud, and very HOT. The food was under seasoned, if it wasn't for the sweat dripping from my pores onto my plate, I think it would have been a below sub par type of meal. Beer menu and the space were most likely the most impressive things about this bar.

nqZJXa-xN2hG1cempEsnFA.text: This is definitely not the place you will go if you are planning for a quiet dinner. Located at the basement with low ceiling, we feel like hearing surround sound everywhere.  We are here for the mussels, traditional style is the flavour to go for, and also don't miss out the sauce (soup) at the bottom。 They are so fresh and tasty, I imagine adding some rice  so we can have seafood congee。They gave us some lobster tattoo stickers after the dinner, where my goddaughter loved it and put it on right away.

GG0fJ-2oZv9N3G8VV_4RTg.text: We came here for lunch party of 4 during the weekend. No reservations were needed the restaurant was really large and there were plenty of seats opened. The service was good and the food was ok. We ordered the different Moules mussels options. They have a lot of beer options and it's a good spot for a larger group.

Iz1-oVf1fuZnUBiNnV1sBQ.text: Not a bad place to enjoy Belgium foods but better if there are more variation on menus. Ambience is not bad at all. However, it may turns out to be a very noisy place due to a large number of group.

QO3L2R7rrPAmQF7gJiOFng.text: We really wanted to like this place.  We basically had dessert for dinner, and the waffles we got were good, but not extravagantly so. My wife is Belgian and we love Belgian food, but man... the service was so slow as to really put us out. We know that American and European standards for restaurant service are a little different, and we're not insulted by needing to ask for the check or anything, but these waiters seemed to studiously avoid our direction when we were trying to get their attention. To top it off, it was really cold where we were seated. So.... not a good experience.

DLw8QrL73I5tgXv_W-6Qog.text: Great food and good beer!Fun place to go for good food and good beer!  Interesting themed restaurant serving Belgium food and beer.  Great fun for a night out!  We had vegetarian and meet dishes and all was tasty.  The highlight was the beer!

WQgsXR77r7dpyme4b8xd_w.text: Belgo's has gone way down in quality. This was my first time back in a couple years, and I was sad to see it's not good anymore. Pros: interesting concept, cheap for London, food is ok. Cons: tired decor, French fries were average at best (lukewarm and not crisp), which is a bit of a crime for a Belgian restaurant, and less than stellar service (slow, inattentive, & unfriendly). We had to request spoons, which should be a given when serving mussels in broth. Also, the bread is soft instead of toasted or hard crust baguette, so when you dip it in the broth, it disintegrates. Overall, it's not terrible, but when you go to London with so many great choices, it doesn't make the grade. I won't be going back.

6qrD4HxTlZHjNKOxhe96jQ.text: great seafood, mussel dishes, etc but the place has lost it folk Belgian dishes, only vestige is the wild boar dish  gone is sausage and kraut hearty dishesflavored beers are greatnoisy friendly active place in basementone downside is that place is unbearably hot, no matter the weather outside   they should spend a buck on air conditioning

QhYKxEqDJdDq2aw9CcTJsQ.text: I visited Belgo Central during beer festival week and the atmosphere was electric. Here is a great place to try a variety of beers and one of the few places in London with a good selection of fruit beers. The mussels are served in a good value heap and tasty creamy sauce and the vegetarian starter platter comes with an addictively delicious cheese as well as satisfyingly crunchy carrot sticks and celery. There was also a wonderful live band that night. As such, Belgo can deliver a joyous all-round dining experience.

BekYIFjr20udSHGMPzl6-A.text: This is what our group ordered:CroquettesTraditionelle Moules Kilo PotWild Mushroom BoucheeSmoked Salmon and Leek TartletLinguinePork and Herb SausagesCarbonnadeNow the last time I had Belgian food was over 15 years ago.  I do not remember it and therefore have nothing to compare this meal to.  That being said, everything we ordered here was terrific (except for the tart, which was agreed upon by the table as just ok).  They have a great selection of Belgian beer and the service was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Pauwel Kwak

Fp7gcmlxhH6pX0ZQzqak7w.text: The was, by far, the worst dining experience my husband and I had during our 2.5 week vacation in the UK.  There were 2 positives about this place: The mussels were perfectly cooked (tender and without any grittiness) and my husband enjoyed the lobster bisque.  Now to the negatives:Although the mussels were cooked perfectly, they were utterly flavorless.  We got two different broths and neither had any flavor.  We ended up dousing each, individual muscle with lemon and salt to be able to eat them. The fries were just passable.The service, while friendly, was exceptionally SLOW and confused.  After we were seated, it took a long time for anyone to come to our table to take our food or drink order.  After ordering, my husband got his soup fairly quick, but we had to wait over an hour for our mussels. We saw 3, yes 3, parties come and go at the table next to us.  We asked our waiter about our order, but he completely disappeared.  We finally flagged down another waiter and explained the situation.  He was actually very nice and managed to get our order to us.  Apparently, the kitchen never got or order. So, the mussels get to us...the problem: I get the wrong order.  I ordered the Thai mussels because they were dairy-free.  But, instead, I got the Provencale.  The waiter took the mussels back; then, he returned a short time later with the same pot of mussels and the manager.  She claimed that the kitchen changed my order to the Provencal because the Thai mussels have dairy.  I pointed out that the menu clearly states that they are dairy-free.  She said, "no, they have coconut milk."  I asked if it was plain coconut milk because I know some places mix it with cream. When she said that it was in fact just coconut milk, I told her that coconut milk is NOT dairy.  She condescendingly told me I was wrong and that all coconut milk has dairy in it.  How are you the manager of a restaurant and think that coconut milk is dairy?!  She finally said that she would get my order of Thai mussels.  At that point, I was pissed, hungry, and my husband's mussels were getting cold.  So, I told her to just leave the Provencale.  During that entire exchange, the waiter (the nice one) actually looked embarrassed and ashamed that he worked there.  In addition to that debacle, our drinks were never refilled, we were never asked if we wanted more wine, and no one ever checked on us.  When we got our check, which also took an insane amount of time, we were shocked that they didn't take the mussels off of our check.  We were going to complain, but just wanted to get the hell out of there.  By the way, we weren't the only ones with issues.  Of the 3 parties that came and went at the table next to us, 2 had problems.  One of them  was charged wrong on their bill.  They had to argue with the waiter to fix the amount.  The other was brought the wrong order.  Between those errors and the ones I dealt, there was not a single apology.The entire dining experience was over 2 hours of MISERY!

bu68REIPxA42OSTSgvpjfg.text: I totally did not expect to see a place like this in London. It's super modern but lots of concrete and an "underground" feel to it. (Mostly because it's in a basement.)While the food here was one of our better meals and actually pretty awesome, the service really knocked down our experience big time. We were seated upon our arrival but the hostess was not very friendly and seemed pretty pretentious.We had a reservation and once we were seated, it took about 15 minutes for someone to come by to greet us and to ask if we wanted anything to drink. In fact, no one came over - my Dad had to go up to someone and ask for them to take our order. It seemed that no one really wanted our table or knew who was assigned.A woman came over to take our order. A while after, a man came over to check on us and to drop off drinks. Our food was delivered by 3 other people. I'm not sure we saw the same person twice. The food was really awesome. I had a steak with bearnaise sauce and fries. It was a really heavy meal but the steak was cooked perfectly, the sauce was perfect and the fries were even good! (I am usually a pasta/rice person and don't really eat many potatoes.) I think this place just needs to lose the attitude and it will be much better.Oh, and try the strawberry beer. Really good.

Q7wU4AGyTgqK3QatLRfRMA.text: Pretty good, not amazing.  The place is huge and maze-like, with lots of different areas and plenty of seating.  Well-cooked and generous mussel portions, perfectly decent frites, and good but slightly odd beer selection.  Let me clarify, since beer is very important to me.The tap list is a little weak, with mostly mild-flavored, low-ABV beers.  My wife ordered a Brugse Zot Blonde, which turned out to be one of the weakest Belgian blondes either of us had ever had.  She only drank a few sips.  The bottle list is better, but not all in stock.  I tried to order the only Trappist ale I'd never had before, an Achel Brune, but got a distinctly cool reception on that from the waitress, who said she didn't know if they had it (hm, okay) and strongly recommended the Straffe Hendrik instead.  The latter was excellent, exactly what I wanted, so no harm, no foul, but the response was odd.Which brings me to the low point; the service.  Our waitress was a little scary - unsmiling, abrupt, and difficult to find when we needed refills on water or the check.  A few other people came by the table to check on us, but it was difficult to tell whether they could serve us or not.  So ultimately, a 3.5-star experience.  Good mussels, some good beer, odd service, middling prices.  Might go back if I'm craving mussels and Belgian beers I already know well.  Might try somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. They go through a lot of beer.

TnZn6htjffFmbHXhDVU5Kw.text: I'm going to have to go back and try them again, the food was good, but I and one other on our table were just really disappointed by what we received. We were a large group and while it was mostly okay, we had a couple of problems...For a place that prides itself on beer, please learn how to pour it! The guy serving us seemed to think that the greater the height you poured it from the better it would be... We ended up with massive foamy heads on our beers that would overflow the glass. Not the way it should be done. The beer is exceptionally tasty though!Secondly a couple of us got the mussel platters, and were really disappointed by it, on my platter, they were overcooked, and seemed to be missing the pancetta, the other guy who had the same dish definitely had at least some on his plate. Also the size of the dish compared to the others was disproportionate. Literally got what seemed like half what anybody else ordered.That said, it was a good night, I will go back but I'll be ordering something else and pouring my own beer...

pBDGiucY4_Zy40zl-fJ2pQ.text: As I was looking for a restaurant in London, this restaurant came on top list on Qype so I went to there with my friend.And yes it is very good. A bowl of mussels, fries and a drink under tenner! It is very good price for London. The service was so quick and polite and the waiters wear very exotic costume! The ambiance is pretty good. The seat is not that comfortable( made by metal like a bench) so I could not feel comfortable to stay long...Anyway it is nice if you look for a cheap and yummy lunch in London, which is quite hard to find !

tVyzQTZQFsH57oPbBtEBzQ.text: Very unusual place - in the basement of what seems to be an old warehouseA great venue for the larger groups, with bench style seating and some very large tablesFood is delicious - famous for good mussels but other dishes are also very goodVery interesting and tasty beers availableOnly negative point is that due to all the noise and excitement, it can be difficult to get the attention of the waiting staff

gAhbeCpfkq4YqO0cI9t5EA.text: Belgo was great!  It is a bit of an odd entrance to the restaurant, but all of the sudden you are seated down in the caverns of the basement.  The mussels and frittes were awesome and the stew was also great.  Prices were very reasonable, especially for dinner in London!

MhiXc7GcPnGhsR6fGsXtRg.text: I went for the the beat-the-clock deal where the time that you order is the the price you pay (if you order at 6 you pay £6.) Unbelievably, the deal included the mussels I ordered along with a beer and a shot.  Both the mussels and the Belgian white were very good and so was the service provided by staff dressed in monk outfits.

XgZDL2h1cSWzc4uHWNsXmw.text: Good spot in London for some Belgian food and beer. The service is quick and the food is tasty once you get seated. They have a fine selection of beverages that go well with your meal. Interesting bathroom too... with the fountain-esque sink.

IYhnpbOErvBTQnor9CRqqA.text: Every year Belgo's has an annual 'Lobsterfest' which has become a bit of an institution for my boyfriend and his friends. The lobster's are half price and served with chips and mayonnaise- a marriage made in heaven. It's incredible to watch as the lobster's arrive to the table and a hushed silence suddenly falls. Everyone is concentrating so hard on reaching that last delicious scrap of lobster from its shell that there is no time to socialise. The boys find it a very primal, manly affair. In fact, they regress so much I wouldn't be surprised if one of them asked to keep the carcass as a trophy to warn off other lobster's... During the rest of the year, Belgo's makes an equally fun night out and it's moules frites are unbeatable anywhere in the capital. Being a popular spot for a good feed it can get very busy and I've known it to take 45 minutes to get a table. However, this wait is easily spent sipping one of the many beers they have on offer in the bar upstairs. Really, there is nothing they haven't thought of!

GA2hRXg-4H5rwJrw1mfAUg.text: very suitable for group, friendly services with good food

T_1oMFUX6BejlttsvWCa-g.text: Great location, industrial decor, and consistent menu.Although I love the moules frites, I've been experimenting with the menu, and have not been disappointed. It's sad that the old seafood platter and creamed spinach of Ladbroke Grove fame is no more.

gr3jNeqe-ePm84VMB-RslQ.text: I suppose it's a bit odd to review a place that specializes in mussels when the thought of eating one makes me queasy, but honestly Belgo is more than that. I have been a fan of Belgo for years and have kept up with my free meal punch card despite the fact that I live in America. I am one punch away for a free meal! I think Belgo has the best value in the city with all of their promotions, the clock-watcher promo, the express lunch, and best of all the food is actually good. Usually a place that offers so many gimmicks and discounts does so because they have no other way to draw in customers. I love the roast chicken and think the frites are some of the best in the world. I have also enjoyed a rabbit dish and had some very good wursts. My mussel eating friends have raved about the freshness of the mussels and I have deigned to dip my bread in the various mussel sauces at the edges of their plates and found it to be very tasty indeed. All of these factors combined with a central, although somewhat hard to initially find location and waitstaff dressed in monks robes and you have a winner on your hands.

h5G5TnmmUOagmXHO4zlNnQ.text: I love this place. I've tried a few things on the menu but you cant beat mussels, chips and a beer. The beer selection is ace, so much choice and you're unlikely to go wrong if you choose one of Chimay, Duvel or De Koninck. To be on the safe side, ask the waiter as they are always very helpful for recommendations. The service is good here thanks to them. One last thing, the venue is underground and has a nice canteen style vibe to it.

Z2yOfxFKJwC2RBFK-wK-Vw.text: Following the struggle of getting off the Piccadilly Line train , the near death experience of choosing the staircase over the elevators in Covent Garden Station and dodging like bullets  all the Ked's wearing-thin tie hipsters on Neal Street I finally arrive at the red brick building that is Belgo Central."Hi , table for two please?" who am I kidding? That would be "Table for one", once receiving the corresponding look that follows the 'billy no mates' reservation, I am guided down the dungeon staircase.The decor is brilliant and fits the open kitchen approach, whilst the smells of Belgian lager and seafood linger in the air, preemptive of the medieval feast that is about to commence.Thai green Mussels, Hoegaarden and Rye bread, simply delicious. I can vouch for most items on the menu, you will not be disappointed.The place falls short of a five star review as the quality although great is sometimes hit and miss. Avoid Friday and Saturday night and aim for  a week day, preferably lunch time where the food is not popping out at factory speeds but taking its time.Final point,  closed mussels are still perfect to eat! Lets end this perpetual myth...

10QEa4PZgMPGSiAtOOX5mg.text: Went here last night while on a short business trip to London and had a great meal.  I can't speak for the rest of the menu, but the Thai mussels were great.  They also have a great selection of Belgian beer.  Definitely recommended.

k_HoHURj1Yt1lORz03dpDQ.text: We love Belgo's!  We go here everytime we visit London.  Beer is made right there.  Amazing!

LfR5dbOLb8DT6LlrAvHEHw.text: Once upon a time, as fairytales often begin, two food & football fans wanted to enjoy a good Belgian meal to celebrate the victory of Belgium during one of the games for the European Football cup (We did say this was a fairytale!). Desperately looking for a decent place in London, our Anglo-Belgian and French-Canadian pioneers found themselves having to make do with a bowl of chips washed down with a Stella Artois. In their quest to honour Belgian cuisine, our two valiant knights decided to launch Belgo, a restaurant dedicated to the perfect national match: beer and food. The place was such a great success that, 12 months later, a few square meters were added to the initial room. A second restaurant, Belgo Centraal, saw the light of day in Covent Garden in 1992. Like in every fairy tale, where miracles allow the wandering prince to find his perfect princess, Belgo's magical recipe was held in three words: Moules, frites et bière; mosselen, frietjes en bier; mussels, chips and beer. Londoners come to enjoy the 73 beers selected from the finest breweries of Belgium and the freshness of the mussels which are consumed at a rate of seven tons a week. Nevertheless, neither enchanted forest nor mysterious creatures welcome you to Belgo and yet the waiters dressed as monks and make it their pleasure to elucidate all the mysteries of beers and Belgian specialties. In a fairy tale, the legends that surround the main story are as important as the plot itself, creating the right atmosphere in which to enjoy the story.The same holds for Belgian beers: When enjoying a glass of Orval trappist beer, you may notice the fish printed on the glass. Legend says that Countess Mathilde was walking next to a lake when her wedding ring fell into the water. Having lost her husband recently, her ring meant a lot to her and she prayed for the ring to be returned to her. A fish suddenly leapt from the water, holding the ring in its mouth. As a gratitude to God, Countess Mathilde decided to build a monastery on the lake's shore As with any successful quest, it is time to celebrate what made Belgo famous: the beer. For the occasion of Oktoberfest (Oct. 1st  31st), and a friendly donation of £27.50, the restaurant will kick off the festifities with a 3-course menu of Belgian specialties, each matched to its own beer. Among the starters, the Shelled mussels in a cream & De Koninck monay sauce with buttered leeks in a puff pastry case, paired with Brugs Wit is a fine introduction to Belgian cuisine with tasty mussels and a delicate sauce. The pastry is light and the portion is ideal for a starter. The Brug Wit is soft and sweet, opening the palate for all the pleasures to come. The crunchy yet creamy soft Belgian cheese croquettes made with Orval trappist beer served with Orval beer melt in the mouth. They are served with well-balanced sweet and sour piccalilli. The Orval beer is quite fruity, and is the ideal match for the tang of the piccalilli. As a main course, my favourite goes to the puff pastry case filled with wild mushrooms in an Orval beer with Truffle cream sauce with asparagus spears and button onions matched with Steenbrugge Blond.The well-rounded fruity hoppy beer cleanses your palate just so with every mouthful to savour the delight of puff pastry perfection, smooth Truffle cream sauce, and crisp asparagus. The braised beef cooked in Faro beer, nutmeg and brown sugar paired with Mort Subite Gueuse is one of the classical Belgian dishes where the slow, 8-hour cooking process allows the meat to absorb all the flavours and release an even sweetness. The sweet and fruity Mort Subite Gueuse beer may have emphasized the sweetness of the dish a bit too much, though, and the portion was truly belgian. As an ode to Belgian chocolate, the Belgian dark chocolate cheesecake on a biscuit base with cherry beer coulis was the perfect choice for dessert. Each morsel is a pure pleasure to the palate, the spicy cherry beer coulis balancing nicely with the delicacy of the chocolate.The paired Früli Strawberry beer was reminiscent of a fruit smoothie with a slightly more bitter taste; a good choice if you're the kind of person who needs a sweet taste after a meal. The Oktoberfest is the perfect example of the definition of Belgian cuisine: In the words of our master waiter, a combination of German portions with French culinary skills. German portions indeed. Make sure to have your stomach ready for a feast!

OQsG9TJN-R7b_UBHtc02xA.text: A tight stairway or industrial elevator transport you to another world, where trappist-robed servers lead you to long benches in a brick-vaulted-ceiling cellar.A must-see every time I visit London. This place has excellent mussels, crispy frites, and of course, beer. The menu is worthy being a text for a lesson in Belgian beer-making history. They also offer several flavors of Genever, a fruit liquor almost impossible to find outside of Belgium.Unisex bathroom stalls with a shared sink are a clean adventure, and the price is right. Who could ask for anything more?

Y4Q3pBwDtYGJayQt8_NvMQ.text: My parents took me here when I was in the process of moving to England for a year. I love mussels and I love fries... put them together in a bucket? Amazing. The decor is a little bit bizarre, but it does help to make a more fun atmosphere. I could have done without the disgusting little schnapps samples though. Not a fan of the overly sweet, syrupy drinks.

jl2d-kSRxlHm0fFpR35TpA.text: A cool place to try dishes that are partly familiar, but also different enough to be a novelty. Very unique ambiance (you feel like you're being served by monks!), friendly service and seating laid out in an open and communal sort of way. Food is tasty and good prices for Sevendials/Covent Garden. Cool washbasin at the toilets!

qIRsqWNcwaBO8ZPi72n3eg.text: Bring back Belgo Bill! This is my absolute favourite place to eat in Covent Garden, minus the draconian monks that work there as waiters (half the time I come here they look like they're about to flog me). That said, it's got a great feel to it and the food has never disappointed!  Some favourites are the traditional moules et frites, croquettes, confit duck salad (with black pudding-the only time I'll eat it), and of course belgian waffles for dessert. Not to mention, they have a fantastic selection of fruit beers!

b8LjzTqWQScWt2cfHLP4jA.text: Great great great spot for excellent beers, mussels and roasted chicken.  Service was attentive and friendly.

1NFtKzgeyVDqAP7Im7FEmw.text: Excellent variety of beers, great atmosphere, and exquisite dishes. I had the mussels in Thai green curry sauce and they were delicious. Prices were reasonably good too. Would definitely recommend it!

BoTA_hetPJd0_jXEsrV1Og.text: Such a fun place! Walk in and it's dimly lit and has a bar/club type feel. Then they take you downstairs and you're in an underground tavern/open room type seating area with picnic benches etc. It's great.The food is perfect and cooked in an English demeanor (slightly bland) so be prepared to temper your expectations. Their drink selection is decent to very good and the prices are exceptional. Definitely get a drink even if you're not a drinker.It's worth the visit at least for a late night bite. Trust me.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Menu as of 9/23/18
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

i4WxiBoO51ciSeC1LcGhNA.text: Both the food and waitress are the best Love the moules and mussel popcorn!!It's the first that I've tried some Belgian food, and hopefully it turned out to be good!

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

TcbrMBfJF65swmdrGTMWdg.text: We have been going here for over twenty years.  The service is outstanding.  The beer selection is phenomenal .  And the food is consistently great, with a special shout out to the frites.

nSK1aThkgeCRFQFeAlDHyg.text: Tipsily walked into this restaurant after grabbing a few drinks at the nearby pubs. Bigger than it looks from the outside as the top floor leads into the lower floor with much more seating for various groups of people. Saturday late night, not too many people inside, so was able to sit immediately.To start off, shared the Dirty Fries (£9) - a mound of well crisped fries topped with cheese sauce, tomato sauce, "bacconaise", and pancetta. Not as saucy as the ingredients suggest, yet easy to share and hot off the fryer. For the main course, ordered the Savoury Waffle (£9) - a darkened waffle topped with chilli tomato ragu and a poached egg. Sections off quite nicely and the runny egg is an interesting topping over the dense waffle. Also ordered drinks from the solid list, but can't remember what they were.Cool spot to chill and relax in booths with a group of people. Food is an excellent indulgence if in the mood.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. "Dirty" Fries
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Savoury waffle
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Drink menu

UdGo8W68U8vWasYoJ62IZw.text: We ordered moule pot with traditional sause and pan roasted cod. Mussels pot is enough for 2 people, and traditional sause is garlic butter. Food is great, beer is as well. Highly recommend if you love seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Pan fired cod.
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Pot with traditional sauce.
Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom

Z_oDiQNZ1yzNx3UFUlJqgA.text: The drop of the star is because this place is really loud!  The restaurant is in the basement with low ceilings and long tables/benches, so if you're not into getting close to your fellow diners, eat elsewhere.  That said, there is certainly a great atmosphere and even if conversation is limited (or at full volume) it has a certain je ne sais quoi.Coming to Belgo and not having mussels would be like coming to London and not riding on a double decker bus!  The mussels were some of the best I've ever had!  No rubbery or sandy molluscs here!

photos.caption: Photo of Belgo Centraal - London, United Kingdom. Mmmussels...

h9IldguC_LdUla23UJkr4g.text: Was very excited to try the mussels pot out coming from USA, reason for three stars is due to the mussel pot not being extraordinary, can find some places in USA northeastern states with better taste. Fyi i had the tomato base pot and the cream one, the cream one is much better. The mussel popcorn would be 4 star as it was great! Lobster bisque 3 stars.  Cheers!

Hd-RzDyzC_9k4z7GV3zogg.text: Celebrated my three year wedding anniversary at Belgo's. The food and drinks were delicious, and the waiter was really good! We had no dinner reservations and we were seated fairly quickly. The reason why I'm not giving this a five star is because we were sat next to a group of obnoxious over the top loud people. I couldn't carry a proper conversation because we couldn't hear each other at all! Asides from that, I would definitely come back.

QNFRa5r_lagE7YvRNem9SQ.text: Wonderful placeGreat beer selection and a great selection of mussel possibilities!Fair prices and positive atmosphere--Turned out I knew a bunch of people who have eaten there- go figure!Everyone gives the place a thumbs up!

JeD7ooHKtOeF3nOt-f3jaQ.text: This place was super fun.  The mussels were fantastic, the savory waffle with red sauce and sausage was fantastic, but the winner was the steak.  Superb.  We had a bubble waffle and chocolate fondue for dessert, loved every bite.  Great beer list, good service.

TRGavozMpdiksTFA2nfUmA.text: Went with a large group and received horrible service. Note tip is automatically added to the bill as well. It was an especially busy night but even so, service was well sub par. Overall good selection of beers and well prepared food. The arched ceiling of the beer hall provides a unique casual ambience.
